par.text: Arsenic is a metalloid. It occurs in several allotropic forms, the most stable being grey arsenic. It is brittle, exhibits metallic lustre; is a weak conductor of heat and electricity, insoluble in water. The other two forms - yellow and black arsenic - are unstable crystalline substances. When heated, arsenic burns with a blue flame to produce arsenic(III) oxide – A
. In the reaction with chlorine, arsenic(III) chloride – AsC
- is formed. Arsenic and its compounds are poisonous. The name of the element is derived from the Latin word
The element was discovered most probably by the alchemist Alberts Magnus in 1250.
